--- format: html: code-fold: show code-summary: "Ocultar código" code-line-numbers: false code-annotations: false code-link: true code-tools: source: true toggle: true caption: "Código" code-overflow: scroll page-layout: full editor_options: chunk_output_type: console categories: - geom_richtext execute: eval: false echo: true warning: false title: "Semana 45" date: last-modified author: Víctor Gauto --- Cantidad de casos de tuberculosis cada 100000 habitantes en Argentina. ::: {.column-page-right} ![Semana 45, 2025](semana_45.png) ::: ## Paquetes ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(glue) library(ggtext) library(showtext) library(tidyverse) ``` ::: ## Estilos Colores. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} col <- nord::nord(palette = "polarnight", n = 4) c1 <- "#D8DEE9" c2 <- "#D8DEE9" ``` ::: Fuentes: Ubuntu y JetBrains Mono. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} font_add( family = "ubuntu", regular = "././fuente/Ubuntu-Regular.ttf", bold = "././fuente/Ubuntu-Bold.ttf", italic = "././fuente/Ubuntu-Italic.ttf" ) font_add( family = "jet", regular = "././fuente/JetBrainsMonoNLNerdFontMono-Regular.ttf" ) showtext_auto() showtext_opts(dpi = 300) ``` ::: ## Epígrafe ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} fuente <- glue( "Datos: ", "{{tidytuesdayR}} semana 45, ", "getTBinR, Sam Abbott." ) autor <- glue("**Víctor Gauto**") icon_twitter <- glue("") icon_instagram <- glue("") icon_github <- glue("") icon_mastodon <- glue("󰫑") icon_bsky <- glue("") usuario <- glue("**vhgauto**") sep <- glue("**|**") mi_caption <- glue( "{fuente}
{autor} {sep} {icon_github} {icon_twitter} {icon_instagram} ", "{icon_mastodon} {icon_bsky} {usuario}" ) ``` ::: ## Datos ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2025, 45) who_tb_data <- tuesdata$who_tb_data ``` ::: ## Procesamiento Me interesan los casos cada 100000 habitantes en Argentina. Filtro los datos para Argentina y agrego la columna `y` con las unidades de cantidad de casos. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} d <- filter(who_tb_data, country == "Argentina") |> select(year, e_inc_100k) |> mutate(l = as.list(e_inc_100k)) |> mutate(y = map(l, ~ 1:.x)) |> unnest(y) ``` ::: Defino símbolos para la calavera () y los pulmones (). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} calavera <- glue("󰚌") pulmón <- glue("") ``` ::: ## Figura Título y figura. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mi_titulo <- glue( "Casos de tuberculosis en Argentina ", "cada **100.000** habitantes" ) g <- ggplot(d, aes(year, y)) + annotate( geom = "richtext", x = I(.5), y = I(.5), fill = NA, label.color = NA, label = calavera, size = 360, color = col[2] ) + geom_richtext( label = pulmón, color = c2, family = "jet", fill = NA, label.color = NA, size = 9 ) + scale_x_continuous(expand = expansion(mult = 0, add = .5)) + scale_y_continuous( breaks = c(1, seq(5, 35, 5)), expand = expansion(mult = 0, add = .7) ) + labs(title = mi_titulo, caption = mi_caption) + coord_equal() + theme_void(base_size = 14, base_family = "ubuntu") + theme_sub_legend(position = "none") + theme_sub_plot( background = element_rect(fill = col[1]), title = element_markdown(hjust = .5, size = rel(2), color = c2), title.position = "plot", margin = margin(b = 15, t = 10), caption = element_markdown( size = rel(1.2), color = c2, lineheight = 1.2, margin = margin(t = 15, b = 15) ) ) + theme_sub_axis( text = element_text(color = c1, family = "jet", size = rel(1.3)), ticks = element_line(color = c1), ticks.length = unit(5, "pt") ) + theme_sub_axis_y(text = element_text(margin = margin(r = 5))) + theme_sub_axis_x(text = element_text(margin = margin(t = 5))) ``` ::: Guardo. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} ggsave( plot = g, filename = "tidytuesday/2025/semana_45.png", width = 30, height = 45, units = "cm" ) ``` :::
